text: butternut-squash polenta with sausages
and onions sounds maybe a little too
fussy for your typical weeknight dinner
but not this recipe I've streamlined the
process so what you get is a really
special after work meal but with a twist
I have a piece of squash here you can
buy that pre-cut pre-peeled squash and
use that that's fine or if you were in a
hurry after work and you want to do this
before you leave in the morning you can
do that too it'll actually keep for a
few days in the fridge there's a polenta
myth out there some people will tell you
that you have to constantly stir polenta
after you add it to the pot but that's
not true you just stir it every now and
again it's fine also gonna add a bay
leaf a lot of salt polenta can take a
lot of salt this is a more streamlined
way of cooking the squash and the
polenta at the same time and what's nice
is that it as sweetness and then you
have the savory sausage I'm using fine
instead of extra fine polenta here
don't use the quick cooking either
because if you use the quick cooking the
squash won't cook
you want it to go so nice looking bay
leaf lots of butter you can just let the
polenta hang out while you do the
sausage get your pan hot and right over
here I have Italian sausage you can use
sweet or hot whatever you like and now
the sausage I cut the sausage up into
bits
you can also buy bulk sausage and just
crumble it right in
marry if you have fennel sausage you
could skip the fennel seed if you left
could also add some hot red pepper
flakes right here that would be good too
once your sausages are all browned and
cooked
we just wanna drain them on a paper
towel and then I'm gonna caramelize the
onions in that sausage fat this step is
gonna take ten or fifteen minutes you
want your onions to get really golden
it's just really tender and it should
just kind of flop right in the pan and
now I can just add the sausage right
back in and all the little brown bits
and then that's it you just want to
serve it over your polenta in these cute
little bowls we should have some in
green you know would be perfect if I put
a fennel bulb in with the onion and then
have the fronds to put right on top this
will work a little bit of rosemary right
on the top I know I said that this was
great after work food and it is because
it's a very straightforward recipe but
you know what I would serve this at a
dinner party too
because it is good
you
